column2: You have gathered the proper reagents, the time to forge the container for your soul has come.
The Great Necromancer Nagash was able to defeat death, ascending to Lichedom. As a student of his work, you can attempt the ritual.
In order to ascend, you require a living heart, brain, and soul.

The ritual to ascend to Lichedom is complicated, requiring vital organs taken from another living being to be placed in a phylactery while still living. After an invocation, you must thrust a knife into your own heart, after which your soul will be contained in the phylactery and you will become immortal.
From this prisoner I can begin to harvest the necessary organs for the ritual.
You will live, but your soul shall serve me for eternity!
You have all that you need, all that remains is to forge a phylactery to contain your own soul.
Bring me the greatest smith in the land!
The phylactery is complete. The harvested organs have been placed inside, and all that remains is to end your own life and begin your undeath.
All shall know my name and despair.
You have awakened from the ritual, freed from your mortal shell.
All who live are dust beneath my feet.
This character is a master necromancer who has ascended to undeath and become immortal.
You have finished harvesting organs from your last victim, on to the next one.
The prisoner is dragged before your throne, screaming profanities.
You have devoured enough souls to power a ritual to summon the dead.
Unleash the legions of the damned!
